text: Nikolaus August Otto (10 June 1832 â€“ 26 January 1891) was a German engineer. He is the inventor of the internal-combustion engine. This engine was the first to burn fuel directly in a piston chamber. Up until his invention, all engines were external-combustion engines steam engines and burnt their fuel in a separate compartment. title: Niklaus Otto
